alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 27 at 4:30PM EDT until June 27 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Montgomery County in southeastern Pennsylvania... Central Philadelphia County in southeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 515 PM EDT. * At 430 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Germantown, or over Philadelphia, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Philadelphia, Hatboro, Ambler, Jenkintown, Rockledge, Abington, Bryn Athyn, Wissinoming, Willow Grove, Germantown, Northeast Philadelphia, Center City, Tacony, Kensington, Roxborough, Chestnut Hill, Holmesburg, Ben Franklin Bridge, Horsham and Fort Washington. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 337 and 345. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 22 and 25, and near mile marker 27. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 337 and 341. Interstate 676 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 1. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Mount Holly NJ.
